name: 英語閱讀與寫作
restrict: ◎限外系修習 ◎必須先修過【英文（二）】
description: 透過廣泛性閱讀活動增進學生英語字彙量以及對各類型文章的鑑賞、分析及擷取重要資訊的能力；並透過各式寫作活動，培養學生用英文寫出自己想法的能力。
goals: 強化學生英語文聆聽、閱讀、口語、寫作的表達能力，協助獲取新知。
提昇學生英語文進階溝通能力及文學素養。
syllabus:
Reading and Writing in English (Spring 2020)

Syllabus

Instructor: Chingshun J. Sheu 許景順 ([cjsheu@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:cjsheu@ntnu.edu.tw))

Registration: Before or during the first class meeting.

Class meetings: Wednesdays 1320-1510

Assigned texts: “Frozen Alive,” “The Rising Cost of Education and Health Care Is Less Troubling Than Believed,” and “6 Healthy Relationship Habits Most People Think Are Toxic”; to be provided by the instructor.

Objectives: Students will learn how to write narrative, expository, and argumentative essays that incorporate emotional, informational, and reader-response writing strategies. They will also learn to appreciate the use of these essays and strategies in essays by their peers and published writers.

Grading:

72% Essays

15% Participation

13% Weekly journals

Essays: Students will write three essays, respectively narrative, expository, and argumentative. _If there is plagiarism in drafts, the instructor will provide no feedback. Plagiarism in final submissions will result in an essay grade of 0 (zero)._

Participation: After each peer review session, students will evaluate the level of participation of their group members. These evaluations will not be directly translated into the participation grade, but will rather serve as indicators of participation.

Weekly journal: Students will submit one journal entry each for at least 13 weeks. A journal entry will be graded based solely on whether it has been submitted. Submitting more than 13 journal entries may result in extra credit. _Plagiarized journal entries will not be counted_.
